column4: wastrel caution.  if there is an xorg.conf in the $PWD and you run startx it will read that one rather than the one in /etc/X11/    i had a big fight with that the other day.
i don't think he knows the startx command but thx for the tip :]
can you paste the error at this website: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org   and give us the link?
did you write down the error?  what does it say you should do with xinitrc
sry it's scrolling pretty fast in here :]
did you install the ssh package?  it Just Works for me.
did you make changes to your ssh config?
the guest user exists on the system?
what shell does the guest user have in /etc/passwd
just checking - if it's /bin/false or something you'd get that behavior
i have a lo block in /etc/network/interfaces  you probably should too?
i thought everyone needed a functional loopback network interface - i guess only if you're going to be using network apps...
but you just had to manually configure it ?
